column4: ext has no fragmenting, so lotsa wasted space easily with lotsa small files
Err, ext can fragment, it's just more resilliant, and less likely to fragment.
And the "wasted space" is about block size.  It's something that can be tuned at filesystem creation time.
It does.  But unless you're really really squeezed for space/performance, it's not worth sweatting over :)
